root: Top-level sections mirror README: defaults, pipelines, modules, database, webui, alerts, baseline.
defaults: defaults: global knobs applied to all modules unless overridden.
defaults_llm_enabled: defaults.llm_enabled: true/false to enable LLM payload generation globally by default.
defaults_llm_min_severity: defaults.llm_min_severity: minimum severity that will generate an LLM payload; INFO/WARNING/ERROR/CRITICAL.
defaults_max_excerpt_lines: defaults.max_excerpt_lines: cap lines included around each finding in an LLM payload.
defaults_max_chunk_lines: defaults.max_chunk_lines: legacy placeholder for excerpt length (use max_excerpt_lines).
pipelines: pipelines: reusable grouping + classifier bundles referenced by modules via pipeline name.
pipelines_name: pipelines.name: identifier for this pipeline; modules.pipeline should match it.
pipelines_match: pipelines.match: file-selection rules for this pipeline.
match_filename_regex: match.filename_regex: regex deciding which files a pipeline should handle (e.g., 'rsnapshot.*\.log').
pipelines_match_filename_regex: pipelines.match.filename_regex: regex deciding which files a pipeline should handle (e.g., 'rsnapshot.*\.log').
pipelines_grouping: pipelines.grouping: choose how to chunk the log before classifying.
grouping_type: grouping.type: 'whole_file' for entire file or 'marker' for start/end regex chunking.
pipelines_grouping_type: pipelines.grouping.type: 'whole_file' for entire file or 'marker' for start/end regex chunking.
grouping_start_regex: grouping.start_regex: regex that marks the start of a chunk when type='marker'.
grouping_end_regex: grouping.end_regex: regex that marks the end of a chunk; leave empty to use file end.
pipelines_classifier: pipelines.classifier: classification engine and regex lists.
classifier_type: classifier.type: implementation name such as 'regex_counter' or 'rsnapshot_basic'.
pipelines_classifier_type: pipelines.classifier.type: implementation name such as 'regex_counter' or 'rsnapshot_basic'.
classifier_error_regexes: classifier.error_regexes: patterns counted as errors for severity.
pipelines_classifier_error_regexes: pipelines.classifier.error_regexes: patterns counted as errors for severity.
classifier_warning_regexes: classifier.warning_regexes: patterns counted as warnings for severity.
pipelines_classifier_warning_regexes: pipelines.classifier.warning_regexes: patterns counted as warnings for severity.
classifier_ignore_regexes: classifier.ignore_regexes: patterns to suppress entirely when scanning.
pipelines_classifier_ignore_regexes: pipelines.classifier.ignore_regexes: patterns to suppress entirely when scanning.
pipelines_llm: pipelines.llm: enable per-pipeline LLM payloads and optional prompt_template path.
llm_enabled: llm.enabled: toggle LLM payload generation for this pipeline.
pipelines_llm_enabled: pipelines.llm.enabled: toggle LLM payload generation for this pipeline.
llm_min_severity: llm.min_severity: minimum severity that should produce an LLM payload for this pipeline.
pipelines_llm_min_severity: pipelines.llm.min_severity: minimum severity that should produce an LLM payload for this pipeline.
llm_max_excerpt_lines: llm.max_excerpt_lines: cap on lines kept in the payload excerpt for this pipeline.
pipelines_llm_max_excerpt_lines: pipelines.llm.max_excerpt_lines: cap on lines kept in the payload excerpt for this pipeline.
llm_prompt_template: llm.prompt_template: optional path to a custom LLM prompt template file.
pipelines_llm_prompt_template: pipelines.llm.prompt_template: optional path to a custom LLM prompt template file.
pipelines_ignore: pipelines.classifier.ignore_regexes: regexes for log lines that should be ignored when counting severities.
modules: modules: concrete tasks tying a path + mode to a pipeline and output options.
modules_name: modules.name: friendly identifier for the module (shows up in UI and CLI).
modules_enabled: modules.enabled: master toggle for whether this module should run.
modules_path: modules.path: source log file or directory. Must be readable by logtriage.
modules_mode: modules.mode: 'batch' for one-shot scans, 'follow' for tailing, 'journal' placeholder if added later.
modules_pipeline: modules.pipeline: name of the pipeline entry controlling grouping/classifier for this module.
modules_min_print_severity: modules.min_print_severity: minimum severity printed to stdout for this module.
modules_llm: modules.llm: settings for emitting LLM payload files per module.
llm_emit_llm_payloads_dir: llm.emit_llm_payloads_dir: directory where LLM payload files should be written.
modules_emit_llm_payloads_dir: modules.llm.emit_llm_payloads_dir: directory where LLM payload files should be written.
llm_llm_payload_mode: llm.llm_payload_mode: 'errors_only' (default) or 'full' for what goes into LLM payload files.
modules_llm_payload_mode: modules.llm.llm_payload_mode: 'errors_only' (default) or 'full' for what goes into LLM payload files.
llm_only_last_chunk: llm.only_last_chunk: legacy toggle to look at only the latest run; ignored in findings-first mode.
modules_only_last_chunk: modules.llm.only_last_chunk: legacy toggle to look at only the latest run; ignored in findings-first mode.
modules_exit_code_by_severity: modules.exit_code_by_severity: map severity to process exit codes for automation.
exit_code_by_severity_OK: modules.exit_code_by_severity.OK: exit code when highest severity is OK.
exit_code_by_severity_INFO: modules.exit_code_by_severity.INFO: exit code when highest severity is INFO.
exit_code_by_severity_WARNING: modules.exit_code_by_severity.WARNING: exit code when highest severity is WARNING.
exit_code_by_severity_ERROR: modules.exit_code_by_severity.ERROR: exit code when highest severity is ERROR.
exit_code_by_severity_CRITICAL: modules.exit_code_by_severity.CRITICAL: exit code when highest severity is CRITICAL.
modules_alerts: modules.alerts: webhook and/or MQTT alert sinks with per-module min_severity.
alerts_webhook: alerts.webhook: HTTP callback settings for findings.
modules_alerts_webhook: modules.alerts.webhook: HTTP callback settings for findings.
webhook_url: alerts.webhook.url: endpoint URL for webhook payloads.
modules_alerts_webhook_url: modules.alerts.webhook.url: endpoint URL for webhook payloads.
webhook_method: alerts.webhook.method: HTTP verb to use (e.g., POST).
modules_alerts_webhook_method: modules.alerts.webhook.method: HTTP verb to use (e.g., POST).
webhook_min_severity: alerts.webhook.min_severity: minimum severity that should trigger the webhook.
modules_alerts_webhook_min_severity: modules.alerts.webhook.min_severity: minimum severity that should trigger the webhook.
webhook_headers: alerts.webhook.headers: extra HTTP headers to include (use key: value pairs).
modules_alerts_webhook_headers: modules.alerts.webhook.headers: extra HTTP headers to include (use key: value pairs).
modules_alerts_webhook_header_placeholde: modules.alerts.webhook.headers.<header>: placeholder for custom header values.
alerts_mqtt: alerts.mqtt: MQTT publishing settings for findings.
modules_alerts_mqtt: modules.alerts.mqtt: MQTT publishing settings for findings.
mqtt_topic: alerts.mqtt.topic: topic where findings should be published.
modules_alerts_mqtt_topic: modules.alerts.mqtt.topic: topic where findings should be published.
mqtt_username: alerts.mqtt.username: username for MQTT auth if required.
modules_alerts_mqtt_username: modules.alerts.mqtt.username: username for MQTT auth if required.
mqtt_password: alerts.mqtt.password: password for MQTT auth if required.
modules_alerts_mqtt_password: modules.alerts.mqtt.password: password for MQTT auth if required.
mqtt_min_severity: alerts.mqtt.min_severity: minimum severity that should trigger MQTT publishes.
modules_alerts_mqtt_min_severity: modules.alerts.mqtt.min_severity: minimum severity that should trigger MQTT publishes.
modules_baseline: modules.baseline: anomaly-detection window and multipliers controlling severity bump on anomalies.
baseline: baseline: anomaly-detection window and multipliers controlling severity bump on anomalies.
baseline_enabled: baseline.enabled: toggle anomaly detection for this module.
modules_baseline_enabled: modules.baseline.enabled: toggle anomaly detection for this module.
baseline_state_file: baseline.state_file: JSON file tracking historical counts for anomalies.
modules_baseline_state_file: modules.baseline.state_file: JSON file tracking historical counts for anomalies.
baseline_window: baseline.window: number of past runs to keep in the rolling history.
modules_baseline_window: modules.baseline.window: number of past runs to keep in the rolling history.
baseline_error_multiplier: baseline.error_multiplier: factor above baseline error average that flags an anomaly.
modules_baseline_error_multiplier: modules.baseline.error_multiplier: factor above baseline error average that flags an anomaly.
baseline_warning_multiplier: baseline.warning_multiplier: factor above baseline warning average that flags an anomaly.
modules_baseline_warning_multiplier: modules.baseline.warning_multiplier: factor above baseline warning average that flags an anomaly.
baseline_severity_on_anomaly: baseline.severity_on_anomaly: severity to assign when an anomaly is detected.
modules_baseline_severity_on_anomaly: modules.baseline.severity_on_anomaly: severity to assign when an anomaly is detected.
modules_stream: modules.stream: stream/tailing settings like from_beginning and interval for follow-mode modules.
stream_from_beginning: stream.from_beginning: when true, start reading from the beginning instead of tail.
modules_stream_from_beginning: modules.stream.from_beginning: when true, start reading from the beginning instead of tail.
stream_interval: stream.interval: polling interval (seconds) when following files.
modules_stream_interval: modules.stream.interval: polling interval (seconds) when following files.
database: database: URL and retention_days. Both CLI and Web UI use this DB for historical findings.
database_retention_days: database.retention_days: how many days of stored findings to keep before cleanup.
webui: webui: HTTP binding (host/port/base_path) plus secret_key, allowed_ips, and admin_users.
webui_enabled: webui.enabled: master toggle for serving the Web UI.
webui_host: webui.host: interface to bind the Web UI to (e.g., 0.0.0.0).
webui_port: webui.port: TCP port for the Web UI server.
webui_base_path: webui.base_path: base URL path when running behind a reverse proxy.
webui_secret_key: webui.secret_key: long random string used for session signing; rotate to invalidate sessions.
webui_session_cookie_name: webui.session_cookie_name: customize cookie name to avoid clashes behind reverse proxies.
webui_dark_mode_default: webui.dark_mode_default: true to default to dark mode in the UI.
webui_csrf_enabled: webui.csrf_enabled: toggle CSRF protection for forms.
webui_allowed_ips: webui.allowed_ips: list of IPs allowed to access the Web UI. Empty list means allow all.
webui_admin_users: webui.admin_users: username + password_hash entries for logging into the Web UI.
admin_users_password_hash: webui.admin_users.password_hash: bcrypt (or compatible) hash for the admin password.
webui_admin_password_hash: webui.admin_users.password_hash: bcrypt (or compatible) hash for the admin password.
alerts: alerts: shared options for webhook/MQTT alerting across modules, if used.
